lines.text: Pardon me sir, but haven't you come to the wrong college?
This is Oxford isn't it?
Yes but, you're dressed for Eton
Just as well, we haven't eaten since breakfast
This joint is really screwy! There's a gent over there who just said he wants his salad served undressed!
Well, you heard what he said - serve the salad undressed!
[last lines]
Ollie, where ya goin'?
Back to America for me!
Ollie?
What?

[starts to cry]
You're going without me...
Stan! You know me!
Well, of course I know you... What do you have, one of those dizzy spells?
Hey, Ollie look...
[spans the distance from England to America on a globe with his thumb and forefinger - about two inches]
We're only this far from home.
Einstein?... if it wasn't for that bump on the head he wouldn't know Einstein from a beer stein...
Dirty snitchers.
Repeat that remark again.

[with entire student group]
Dirty snitchers!

[his ears wiggle wildly]
Meredith, hold my handkerchief. Now I demand an immediate apology.
[a fight ensues]

[looking at Ollie]
Meredith, who is this coarse person?

[refering to the Dean]
Have you ever seen a face like that anyhwere but in a zoo?
Sure... in a monkey house.
A monkey house!
[laughs]
I never thought of that!
We're going to run you out of Oxford; and if you don't go, we'll take of your britches and throw you out!
What? Take off my britches? In the presence of Meredith?

[with entire student body, marching]
Fe, fi,fo,fum. We want the blood of an American. Be he alive, or be he dead, we'll break his bones to make our bread. We'll beat those Yankees like a drum. We'll send them back where they came from
[pointing at their window]
Fe, fi, fo, fum.
Fatty, lift up your chin. No no no, both of them!
He must have one of those dizzy spells.
Yeah, he's a dizzy dean!

[in the maze]
Where are you?
I'm over here... where are you?
I'm here.
How can you be here if I'm here?

[speaking of Lord Paddington]
And when he got angry, he would wiggle his ears in the most extraordinary fashion, and he would fight like a demon.
Fight like demon...
[to Stan]
Wiggle your ears.
Huh?

[sternly]
Wiggle your ears!

[Stan tries to wiggle his ears]
I can't wiggle my ears.
Of course not; it's another rib.
Professor Einstein of Princeton is having trouble with his theory; could you possible give him just a little time...
Of course... Fatty, hand me my memorandum
[Ollie gives it to him... he leafs through it]
Let's see... Monday, Tuesday... suppose we make it Ash Wednesday... invite him for lunch, I'm having pancakes.

[to Meredith about Stan]
Brilliant mind?
[laughs]
Why, I've known him for years, and he's the dumbest guy I ever saw. Aren't you, Stanley?
I certainly am!
Listen, I've had enough of this! Why I knew you when I had more brains in my little finger than you had in your whole carcass... even with your overcoat on!
You're a witty old stick-in-the-mud, aren't you, Fatty?
You bet I am, and don't call me Fatty!
Now don't get excited, old boy...
Who's excited? I'm through. You can take your lordships, your Oxford and your Paddingtons and do what you like with them!
I didn't like that double chin crack!
